sources.title: Little Men
sources.description: Title: Little Men Summary: Jo March and her husband Professor Bhaer operate the Plumfield School for poor boys. When Dan, a tough street kid, comes to the school, he wins Jo's heart despite his hard edge, and she ... Directed by: Norman Z. McLeod Actors: Production Company: The Play's The Thing Productions Inc. Release Date: 29 November 1940 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Jo March and her husband Professor Bhaer operate the Plumfield School for poor boys. When Dan, a tough street kid, comes to the school, he wins Jo's heart despite his hard edge, and she defends him when he is falsely accused. Dan's foster father, Major Burdle, is a swindler in cahoots with another crook called Willie the Fox. When the Plumfield School becomes in danger of foreclosure, the two con men cook up a scheme to save the home.

sources.title: Little Men
sources.description: You can find more information regarding this film on its IMDb page

sources.title: Little Men (1940) JACKIE OAKIE
sources.description:
Stars: Jackie Oakie, Ralph Morgan, Jimmy Lydon
 Director: Phil Rosen

 In this follow-up to the near-perfect adaptation of Little Women, a tough street kid is accused of theft at homeless school for boys.

sources.title: Little Men (1940) Comedy, Drama Full Length movie
sources.description:
Jo March and her husband Professor Bhaer operate the Plumfield School for poor boys. When Dan, a tough street kid, comes to the school, he wins Jo's heart despite his hard edge, and she defends him when he is falsely accused. Dan's foster father, Major Burdle, is a swindler in cahoots with another crook called Willie the Fox. When the Plumfield School becomes in danger of foreclosure, the two con men cook up a scheme to save the home.

Director:Norman Z. McLeod
Writers:Mark Kelly
Stars:  Kay Francis, Jack Oakie, George Bancroft 
Genres: Comedy, Drama

metadata.Plot: Jo March and her husband Professor Bhaer operate the Plumfield School for poor boys. When Dan, a tough street kid, comes to the school, he wins Jo's heart despite his hard edge, and she defends him when he is falsely accused. Dan's foster father, Major Burdle, is a swindler in cahoots with another crook called Willie the Fox. When the Plumfield School becomes in danger of foreclosure, the two con men cook up a scheme to save the home.
metadata.Writer: Mark Kelly, Arthur Caesar, Louisa May Alcott
metadata.Actors: Kay Francis, Jack Oakie, George Bancroft
